PART 2
BIDDING AND CONTRACTS
§ 1-201.   Letting Contracts.
   1.   Execution of Contracts. All contracts or purchases of the Township
involving sums in excess of $1,500 shall be in writing and shall be executed on
behalf of the Township by the Township Manager. The Township Manager shall also
execute all contracts, regardless of amount, for the purchase on behalf of the
Township involving sums of less than $10,000. Any purchases on behalf of the
Township by the Township Manager involving sums of more than $10,000 shall be
made only after the lowest responsible prices are sought taking into account
such factors as availability, urgency and convenience. [Ord. 340]
   2.   Approval by Township Attorney. The Township Manager, when required to
execute a written contract, shall request the Township Attorney to approve the
same as to form.
   3.   Authorization for Public Capital Improvements. Authorization for
contracts for the construction of public capital improvements (“Capital
Contracts”) shall be given by Ordinance only (“Capital Contracts”), regardless
of the amount involved.
      A.   A Capital Contract Ordinance shall contain the form of the Capital
Contract, maximum price of the Capital Contract and may be approved by Council
prior to solicitation of offers or proposals of for the Capital Contract, but
not later than the execution of the Capital Contract.
      B.   The price of a Capital Contract shall be the contract price as
determined by other provisions of this Part 2, except that it shall be no
greater than the maximum price established in the Capital Contract Ordinance.
      C.   After approval of a Capital Contract Ordinance, a Capital Contract
may be modified or clarified (a) by procedures authorized by this Part 2 for
determining the contract price, but not to increase the Maximum Price or (b) as
authorized in the Capital Contract Ordinance.
      D.   After a Capital Contract is executed, the Township Manager may
approve change orders which, in the aggregate, do not exceed ten percent (10%)
of the contract price, unless otherwise provided in the Capital Contract
Ordinance. Council may at any time by ordinance raise the maximum aggregate
amount of change orders authorized for a Capital Contract.
      E.   Capital Contract terms for unit prices shall include a statement
estimated by the Township of the anticipated number of units required and,
payment of the costs resulting from exceeding the anticipated number of units
shall not be subject to the maximum contract price.
      F.   Capital Contracts include only contracts for construction of public
capital improvements, not separate Township contracts for architectural or
other design services, testing, reports or similar services related to a
Capital Contract or construction of public capital improvements.
      G.   This Part 2, Section 1-201(3), shall not apply to contracts for
emergency repair of public works of the Township or other routine repair of
public capital improvements to fill potholes, repair cracks, replace broken
windows, restore minor damage caused by accidents and similar repair, but does
apply to replacement or reconstruction of a major component of a public capital
improvement such as replacing a roof, resurfacing a road or upgrading a section
of sewer lines.
   4.   Procedure for Certain Non-Bid Contracts. For all contracts in an amount
of $23,200 or less but more than $12,600 (as adjusted pursuant to § 1-224,
below), the Township shall solicit and receive written offers from at least
three vendors for the products or services to be purchased. If the Township is
unable to receive such written offers, the Township Manager shall provide a
signed written statement documenting the solicitation attempts. Written offers
include those physically received as well as those received by email, telefax
or other text electronic communication. If a vendor which has not submitted the
lowest offer is awarded the contract, the Township Manager shall provide a
statement of the reason for the selection. The Township shall retain such
offers and statements for at least one year following the termination of the
contract to which they applied. [Ord. 534]
(Ord. 64, § 1, 7/12/78; as amended by Ord. 70, § 8.01, 2/14/79; by Ord. 182, 8/
14/85; by Ord. 340, 7/3/1996; by Ord. 534, 12/5/2012, § 1; and by Ord. 658, 11/
20/2024, §§ 1, 2)
§ 1-202.   Competitive Bids.
   1.   General Required. Except as otherwise provided in this Part, no
contract for supplies, material, labor, franchise, or other valuable
consideration, to be furnished to or by the Township, shall be authorized on
behalf of the Township except with the lowest responsible bidder after
competitive bidding. All specifications shall be written so as to be applicable
to more than one supplier.
   2.   Exceptions. Competitive bidding shall not be required for:
      A.   Labor or services rendered by any Township employee.
      B.   Labor, material, supplies or services furnished by one Township
department to another Township department.
      C.   Those where particular types, models or pieces of new equipment,
articles, apparatus, appliances, vehicles or parts thereof are desired which
are patented and available from only one source.
Page Revised 3/2025 (ALP S-15)   1-14
      (CH. 1, Part 2, §1-203)
      D.   Contracts for labor, material, supplies or services aggregating less
than $23,200 (as adjusted pursuant to §
1-224, below) for the item in the year supplied. [Ord. 534]
      E.   Contracts relating to the acquisition or use of real property.
      F.   Contracts for professional or unique service.
      G.   Contracts for emergency repair of public works of the Township.
      H.   Contracts with other governmental entities, authorities, agencies or
political subdivisions.
(Ord. 182, 8/14/85; as amended by Ord. 340, 7/3/1996; by Ord. 534, 12/5/2012, §
2; by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018; and by Ord. 658, 11/20/2024, § 3)
§ 1-203.   Bid Procedures.
Bids may be solicited and processed by a sealed bid or secure electronic bid
procedure as determined by Council.
   A.   Sealed bids. The sealed bid procedure shall utilize paper forms for the
submission of bids and paper or other hard copy supporting documentation.
Requests for proposals may allow information to be submitted on discs or other
physical devise containing electronic data. Bids and supporting documentation
shall be submitted in sealed envelopes which shall remain sealed until bid
opening.
   B.   Secure Electronic bids. The secure electronic bid procedure shall use a
Township or third-party internet based website (""Bid Platform") which has the
capability to post solicitations, receive bids and supporting documentation,
allow bidders to submit questions and amend bids, allow Township to respond to
questions, issue addenda and communicate with bidders, track all communications
processed through the system or access to bids and perform other practices
common to sealed bid procedures. The Bid Platform must secure bids and
supporting documentation received, in whatever form received or stored, so that
no person other than bidder can view or access the bid or any part thereof
until bids are opened by the Township. A Bid Platform shall be accessible to
the public without cost and allow all functions performed through the Platform
to be without cost, but for submitting a bid. Township may require bid bonds or
other such security to be physically submitted to the Township.
   C.   Bid opening. Sealed bid opening occurs when the seal on all bids
received is broken at a public meeting of the Township Council. Electronic Bid
opening occurs when, (i) at a public meeting of the Township Council, it first
accesses the database of all bids on the Bid Platform; or (ii) if a joint
municipal bidding process is used, the data base of all bids on the Bid
Platform is first accessed in a public meeting of a participating municipality
or by the municipal engineer of a participating municipality. All bids
processed under subsection (ii) shall be available for public inspection at no
cost on the Bid Platform website within one hour of the bid opening.
(Ord. 593, 4/4/2018; as amended by Ord. 656, 6/5/2024)
§ 1-204.   Publication Requirements.
   All contracts and purchases subject to competitive bidding requirements
shall not be made until due notice of request for proposals (the solicitation)
is placed: (A) in one newspaper of general circulation, published or
circulating in the County in which the Township is situated, at least three
times, at intervals of not less than 3 days with the first advertisement
published not less than 10 days prior to the date fixed for the opening of
bids; or (B) on a Bid Platform beginning at least 10 days prior to and
continuing until the day fixed for opening bids; and, (C) in addition to (A) or
(B), such other publication as may be required by law, grant or loan
requirement applicable to the subject of the solicitation.
(Ord. 182, 8/14/85; as amended by Ord. 340, 7/3/1996; by Ord. 534, 12/5/2012, §
3; and by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-205.   Contract Amount.
The amount of the contract shall in all cases, whether of straight sale price,
conditional sale, bailment lease or otherwise, be the entire amount which the
Township pays to the successful bidder or his assignee in order to obtain the
services or property, or both, and shall not be construed to mean only the
amount which is paid to acquire title or to receive any other particular
benefit or benefits of the whole bargain.
(Ord. 64, § 4, 7/12/78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-206.   Acceptance of Bids.
The acceptance of bids shall only be made by public announcement at the meeting
at which bids are opened, or at a subsequent meeting, the time or place of
which shall be publicly announced when bids are opened. If for any reason one
or both of the above meetings shall not be held, the same business may be
transacted at subsequent meetings provided that at least 5 days notice thereof
shall be published in the newspaper or Bid Platform in which the notice of the
solicitation was published.
(Ord. 64, § 5, 7/12/78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-207.   Preparation of Bid.
Sealed bids must be written in ink or typewritten and shall be submitted on the
forms issued. Electronic secure bids shall be submitted electronically on the
Bid Platform selected by Council. Bidders are expected to examine all
instructions, specifications, drawings, sites, installations, etc. Failure to
do so will be at the bidder's risk. On sealed bids erasures or other changes
must be initialled by the person signing the bid.
(Ord. 64, § 6(1), 7/12/78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-208.   Pricing.
   1.   Charges and Costs to be Included. All prices are to include all
transportation, delivery and packaging charges to the Township of Hanover or
other destination as specified. All incidental costs such as transfer of
titles, registration plates and/or temporary tags are to be included in the bid
price.
   2.   Deduction for Trade-In. At times, the Township may have equipment of
equal specifications to be traded in which will be available for inspection at
the Township Garage or as specified in the solicitation. Bidders will deduct
for trade in on the bid.
   3.    The Township is exempt from State and Federal taxes, and an exemption
certificate is not required by a political subdivision. Prices shall be
exclusive of all taxes.
(Ord. 64, § 6(8), 7/12/78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-209.   Qualifications of Bidders.
   1.   Domestic Manufacturers or Their Authorized Distributors Only. Bids will
be accepted only from domestic manufacturers, unless not domestically
available, their authorized distributors or dealers who are actively engaged in
the sale or manufacture of the items called for in the bid.
   2.   Equipment Desired. Equipment other than new current year models (unless
otherwise specified) will not be considered.
   3.   Sub-contractors. In the event portions of the units called for in the
specifications are to be installed, constructed or assembled by a sub-
contractor or sub-contractors, the bidder must complete the information
requested in the specifications. The Township also reserves the right to
determine if the necessary facilities are available to the bidder to comply
with the terms of the contract and specifications. This determination will in
no way relieve the contractor of prime responsibility for the completion of the
terms and conditions of the contract.
(Ord. 64 § § 6(9b, c), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-210.   Specifications and Product Description.
   1.   Bids Not Restricted to Brand Names Mentioned. When brand names, model
numbers, etc. are mentioned, they are unless otherwise specified, intended to
indicate type, quality and design, and not intended to be restrictive, but
rather to establish criteria for the intended use. Bids on similar design and
quality will be considered and evaluated.
   2.   Manufacturer's Literature Required. All bidders are required to submit
with their bid, complete manufacture literature which describes the item(s)
being offered.
(Ord. 64 § 6(10), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-211.   Guarantee and Warranty Requirements.
   1.   The bidder guarantees that all items offered for sale comply fully or
are fully equal to the item required and specified.
   2.   All expenses covering return or replacement of defective or improper
merchandise will be assumed by the vendor.
   3.   In no instance shall the vendor refer the Township to any distributor
or manufacturer for settlement of any claim arising from defective or improper
merchandise.
   4.   If the vendor shall fail to replace or repair any defective or improper
merchandise within 30 days from date of notice, the Township may make the
necessary corrective arrangements and charge the cost to money due to vendor or
bill the vendor. The vendor agrees to reimburse the Township in such instance.
   5.   The equipment or item(s) furnished shall carry at least the standard
warranty which is offered to the general public.
(Ord. 64, § 6(11), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-212.   Clarification of Requirements.
   1.   Resolving Conflicting Requirements. In the event that there is a
conflict between standard requirements and requirements stated in SPECIAL or
DETAILED specifications, the SPECIAL or DETAILED instructions shall prevail.
   2.   Exceptions to Specifications. Any exceptions to the Township's
specifications must be explained fully in a bid submission under “Exceptions to
Specifications”
(Ord. 64 § 6(12b), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-213.   Delivery.
Bidder must state delivery time on his proposal. Each item of equipment shall
be clean, lubricated and serviced, ready for immediate use.
(Ord. 64 § 6(13), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-214.   Bid Documents.
   1.   Sealed Bids. Sealed proposals marked for the item bid shall be enclosed
in an envelope, sealed, and clearly labeled so as to guard against opening
prior to the time set therefor.
   2.   Electronic Secure Bids. All proposals shall be submitted electronically
in accordance with Instructions to bidders of the solicitation, or otherwise as
set forth on the Bid Platform. Required bid bonds or other security may be
submitted physically to the Township.
(Ord. 64 § 6(2), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-215.   Bond Requirements.
All bids must be accompanied by a certified check, bank cashier's check or
letter of credit in the amount of 10% of the total bid, or by a bid bond in the
amount of 10% of the total bid which shall be forfeited if the successful
bidder fails to enter into a contract with Hanover Township after notice of
acceptance of his proposal. Such security shall be submitted in accordance with
Section
1-214 above.
(Ord. 64, § 6(3), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 151, 3-28-84; by Ord. 505, 10/20/
2010, § 1; and by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-216.   Time for Receiving Bids.
Bids received prior to the time of opening shall be securely kept unopened.
Bids will be received until thirty (30) minutes before the scheduled start of
the Council meeting at which the bids are to be opened and, in that meeting,
they will be publicly opened and read unless the time has been extended
pursuant to Section
1-206. Any proposal received later than the specified time will not be
accepted.
(Ord. 64 § 6(4), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018; and by Ord. 658,
11/20/2024, § 4)
§ 1-217.   Withdrawal of Bids.
Bids may not be withdrawn for a period of 60 days from the opening thereof
unless the period for award has been extended as provided in §
1-218(2) in which case bids may not be withdrawn for a period of 120 days from
bid opening.
(Ord. 64 § 6(5), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 505, 10/20/2010, § 2; and by Ord.
593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-218.   Award of Contract.
   1.   Award. The award shall be made within 60 days of the bid opening to the
lowest responsible and responsive bidder.
   2.   Delay. If the award is delayed by the required approval of another
government agency, the sale of bonds or the award of a grant, the contract
shall be awarded to the lowest responsible and responsive bidder within 120
days of the bid opening or all bids shall be rejected.
   3.   Extension. Extensions for the date for the award may be made by mutual
consent of the Township and the lowest responsible and responsive bidder.
(Ord. 64 § 6(6a), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 505, 10/20/2010, § 3; and by Ord.
593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-219.   Return of Bid Sureties.
The Township will return bid sureties to all but the two lowest responsible
bidders. The surety of the lowest responsible and responsive bidder will be
returned when the equipment or item(s) is received by the Township or a
construction or manufacture contract is signed by the Township. The surety of
the second lowest bidder shall be returned no later than 7 days after the last
day to award contracts pursuant to §
1-218(1) or (2), as applicable.
(Ord. 64 § 6(6b), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 505, 10/20/2010, § 4; and by Ord.
593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-220.   Reservation of Rights.
The Township reserves the right to waive any formalities in the bidding, reject
any and all bids submitted and to award the contract in the best interest of
the Township.
(Ord. 64 § 6(6c), 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-221.   Acceptance and Payment.
The Township shall have the right to inspect all items purchased, work done,
facilities constructed or installed before acceptance and may reject the same
in whole or in part if any fail to meet the specifications in the contract and
in such circumstances withhold further payment and recover payments previously
made as appropriate.
(Ord. 64 § 7, 7-12-78; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-222.   Maximum Term of Certain Contracts.
The maximum term for certain contracts are provided in the Charter. (See
Charter, §
8.05).
(Ord. 70 § 8.05, 2-14-79; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-223.   Execution of Contracts.
The contract shall be executed by the Township within 60 days of the date that
the contract is awarded.
(Ord. 505, 10/20/2010, § 5; as amended by Ord. 593, 4/4/2018)
§ 1-224.   Adjustment of Exemption Ceiling.
   1.   The dollar amount ceiling for exemptions from required competitive
bidding set forth in §
1-202(2)(D), above, shall be adjusted automatically to conform with adjustments
to the base amount triggering the requirement for public bidding for Second
Class Townships published by the Pennsylvania Department of Labor and Industry
pursuant to Act 84 of 2011 to reflect changes in the Consumer Price Index.
   2.   The dollar amount for the base and ceiling values of contracts
requiring solicitation of written offers as set forth in §
1-201(4), above, shall be adjusted automatically to conform with adjustments to
the base amount triggering the requirement for solicitation of telephone bids
and base amount triggering the requirement for public bidding for Second Class
Townships published by the Pennsylvania Department of Labor and Industry
pursuant to Act 84 of 2011 to reflect changes in the Consumer Price Index.
(Ord. 534, 12/5/2012, § 4; as amended by Ord. 539, 1/14/2013; and by Ord. 593,
4/4/2018)

made.
   2.   Special Meetings. If necessary, the Council Chairman shall call a

available to cover the claim or meet the obligation.
   2.   Violations of Charter. A resident of the township, a Township employee
